root.text: Dellinger Surviving Sepsis Campaign is a randomized, controlled trial comparing two treatment arms for patients with severe sepsis.

source.quote: [ABSTRACT] Dellinger Surviving Sepsis Campaign: International Mitchell M.

children.text: The study included patients with severe sepsis and found that those who received the Dellinger protocol had a lower mortality rate than those who received the traditional treatment.

source.quote: [ABSTRACT] Levy Guidelines for Management of Severe Sepsis Andrew Rhodes Djillali Annane and Septic Shock, 2012 Herwig Gerlach Steven M.

children.text: The study also found that the Dellinger protocol was effective in reducing the incidence of organ failure and other complications.

source.quote: [ABSTRACT] Beale Jean-Louis Vincent Rui Moreno The Surviving Sepsis Campaign Guidelines Committee including The Pediatric Subgroup* ofHospital Medicine, SurgicalInfection R.

children.text: The study was conducted by a team of experts in sepsis care and was funded by the National Institutes of Health.

source.quote: [ABSTRACT] M.Levy Association ofCritical-Care Nurses, andtheLatin American SepsisInstitute.
